metadata.name: Potential Invoke-Mimikatz PowerShell Script
metadata.comment: Detects Invoke-Mimikatz PowerShell script and alike. Mimikatz is a credential dumper capable of obtaining plaintext Windows account logins and passwords.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('dumpcreds')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('dumpcerts')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('sekurlsa::logonpasswords')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('crypto::certificates')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('cert_system_store_local_machine'))))

output.summary: Detects Invoke-Mimikatz PowerShell script and alike. Mimikatz is a credential dumper capable of obtaining plaintext Windows account logins and passwords.

metadata.objective: False positive: Mimikatz can be useful for testing the security of networks Reference: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/security/current/potential-invoke-mimikatz-powershell-script.html#potential-invoke-mimikatz-powershell-script
